# transitionWasCancelled

**Instance Property**

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the transition was canceled.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var transitionWasCancelled: Bool { get }
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the transition was canceled or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] if it is ongoing or finished normally.

## Discussion

You can call this method from your animator object to determine whether the transition has been canceled. Calling the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewControllerContextTransitioning/cancelInteractiveTransition()] method causes this method to return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

## Reporting the transition progress

- **completeTransition(_:)**: Notifies the system that the transition animation is done.
- **updateInteractiveTransition(_:)**: Updates the completion percentage of the transition.
- **pauseInteractiveTransition()**: Tells the system to pause the animations.
- **finishInteractiveTransition()**: Notifies the system that user interactions signaled the completion of the transition.
- **cancelInteractiveTransition()**: Notifies the system that user interactions canceled the transition.
